message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.SD

Reasoning: The paper discusses the use of several state-of-the-art NLP methods, including n-grams, POS tag filters, recurrent neural networks, and latent Dirichlet allocation, to generate political speeches. This suggests that the paper belongs to the Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) sub-category. Additionally, the use of machine learning techniques such as recurrent neural networks and latent Dirichlet allocation suggests that the paper could also belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. The evaluation of the quality of generated speeches using both manual and automated approaches suggests that the paper could also belong to the Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE) and Software Engineering (cs.SD) sub-categories, respectively.
